API Documentation Endpoint 1

API Documentation

Endpoint 1

Retrieves a list of videos from a YouTube channel based on the provided YouTube channel ID.

Parameters:

youtube_channel_id

The ID of the YouTube channel to retrieve videos from.

Type: String

Required: Yes

Response:

Success:

{"videos": [{"id": 1, "url": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=abc123", "title": "Video Title", "author": "Channel Name", "publish_date": "2022-01-01", "description": "Video description goes here", "views": 1000, "length": "00:05:30"}, {...}]}

Returns a list of video objects, where each object contains the following attributes:

  • id: The unique identifier of the video.
  • url: The URL of the video on YouTube.
  • title: The title of the video.
  • author: The name of the YouTube channel that uploaded the video.
  • publish_date: The date the video was published on YouTube.
  • description: The description of the video.
  • views: The number of views the video has received on YouTube.
  • length: The length of the video in the format HH:MM:SS.

Error:

{"message": "No videos found for this channel"}

Returns a 404 error message if no videos were found for the provided YouTube channel ID.

API Documentation Endpoint 1

Twitch Messages API Documentation

Endpoint 2: Retrieve Twitch Messages

Retrieves all messages for a given Twitch username.

URL:

/twitch/messages/<username>

HTTP Method:

GET

Parameters:

username

The Twitch username to retrieve messages for.

Type: String

Required: Yes

Response:

Success:

{
  "messages": [
    {
      "id": ,
      "channel": "",
      "username": "",
      "timestamp": "",
      "message": ""
    },
    ...
  ]
}

Returns a list of messages, where each message is represented as a dictionary with the following keys:

  • id: The unique identifier of the message.
  • channel: The name of the Twitch channel the message was posted in.
  • username: The username of the message poster.
  • timestamp: The timestamp of the message in ISO format.
  • message: The text of the message.

Error:

{
  "message": "No messages found for this user"
}

Returns a 404 status code and a JSON object with a single key message if no messages are found for the specified user.
